Articles.Content: So, I've been mucking around KSP for a while and using the Cheat Sheet on the Wiki to determine how much dV is needed to get different places (Orbit specifically) and I have found that it takes far less than what the cheat sheet is showing to get into orbit. (I haven't done the exact math, but I have gotten into orbit with about 3.8km/s) Have the dV values changed with .22, or is it because I'm doing a gravity turn?

Pretty sure all that stayed the same.

On another note, although you may shave off a few hundred m/s from the 4500 m/s to get to LKO, I am sceptical of your 3800 m/s to orbit claim.

Pretty sure all that stayed the same.

... I am sceptical of your 3800 m/s to orbit claim.

I will post pics next time I pull it off. (Had to restart career mode a time or two and forgot to backup saves)
YEs mods, but nothing too drastic, B9 and KSPX are the only things I use for parts, and MechJeb without autopilot. I usually set my Apoapsis at 75km.

For your viewing pleasure.

Javascript is disabled. View full album
4,523 delta-v to get to 75 km orbit. Sounds normal. I get to 80 km using 4,450. That's a big difference from claiming 3,800.

It's not clear where you're getting 3800m/s dV from, but I think I have an idea...

From the VAB; You start with a total dV of:

Atmosphere: 4918 m/s

Vacuum: 5804 m/s

Once in orbit:

Atmosphere: 1006 m/s

Vacuum: 1281 m/s

It's tempting to say 4918-1006=3912 and say you made it into orbit with 3912m/s dV. But that would be wrong, because the Isp for the engines transitions very non-linearly with altitude. You used 4523m/s if you go by Vacuum-rated dV, which I think is how the charts are "calibrated" since they deal almost entirely with travel in a vacuum.

Maybe. Depends on which cheat sheet you use I suppose.

=Smidge=

MechJeb tracks your dV usage; look it up under the 'recorder' category. I expect you used about 4450 to 4500 m/s.

That number isn't super useful of itself when it comes to planning; it's very close if you used aerospikes, and fairly far if you used nukes, and off by a few percent otherwise.

Yeah the cheat sheets use vacuum isp. I just ignore the atmo figures from KER on launch and when building.

Edited November 18, 2013 by 5thHorseman

MechJeb tracks your dV usage; look it up under the 'recorder' category.

Wait, what?!

Wait, what?!

Click on the 'E' in an info window, switch to the "Recorder" category, select the data you seek.

Yeah the cheat sheets use vacuum isp. I just ignore the atmo figures from KER on launch and when building.
Ah, this makes more sense. And here I have been using Atmo dV so that I'm always over budget (And where the 3800 claim comes from)
